alert.note: Alert for Cerro Gordo; Franklin; Hamilton; Hancock; Hardin; Humboldt; Kossuth; Webster; Winnebago; Worth; Wright (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT HARDIN...EASTERN WEBSTER... SOUTHERN WORTH...WRIGHT...FRANKLIN...SOUTHEASTERN KOSSUTH...EASTERN HUMBOLDT...HANCOCK...HAMILTON...CERRO GORDO AND SOUTHEASTERN WINNEBAGO COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM CDT... At 214 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Garner to 8 miles south of Webster City. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Mason City, Fort Dodge, Webster City, Iowa Falls, Hampton, Forest City, Garner, Clarion, Eldora, Eagle Grove, Belmond, Britt, Ackley, Nora Springs, Manly, Jewell Junction, Sheffield, Rockwell, Clear Lake, and Big Wall Lake. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 127 and 208. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and north central Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Cerro Gordo; Franklin; Hamilton; Hancock; Hardin; Humboldt; Kossuth; Webster; Winnebago; Worth; Wright
